turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about The Hobbit (1977 film).
turn.1: What was special about the Hobbit film?
turn.2: "The Hobbit" was animated by Topcraft, a now-defunct Japanese animation studio whose animation team re-formed as Studio Ghibli under Hayao Miyazaki.
turn.3: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.4: Topcraft successfully partnered with Rankin/Bass on several other co-productions, including "The Last Unicorn".
turn.5: What was the most interesting part of the film?
turn.6: According to Rankin, the visual style of the film took its basic cue from the early illustrations of Arthur Rackham.
turn.7: Did any other artists rate the film or give a comment on it?
turn.8: While Topcraft produced the animation, the concept artwork was completed in the US under the direction of Arthur Rankin.
turn.9: What was the best part of the film?
turn.10: The Rhode Island-based artist Lester Abrams did the initial designs for most of the characters; Rankin had seen Abrams' illustrations to an excerpt from "The Hobbit" in "Children's Digest".
turn.11: Who else was part of the production of the film?
turn.12: Principal artists included coordinating animator Toru Hara; supervising animator/character designer Tsuguyuki Kubo; character and effects animators Hidetoshi Kaneko and Kazuko Ito; and background designer Minoru Nishida.
